intro: Koelpinia scaberrima, commonly known as the rough koelpinia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
